msbt.message: The chest horns on that horned dynastid are the 's pajamas!
I've been meanin' to make myself more intimidatin'. Bet I could learn a thing or two from this giant stag.
Someday I'd like to have teeth like this here saw stag. Except, you know, me-sized teeth.
That there horned hercules is quite the looker!
Seems that mantis has got a nice, wholesome thing goin'. Good for it!
The Madagascan sunset moth's got a bit too much jazz on those flappers for my tastes!
That's a splendid shade of silver on that scarab beetle. Very easy on the eyes.
There's a sight! How'd this great purple emperor get to lookin' so dignified?
Hey, jewel beetle! You gonna pick a color anytime soon? We're waitin'.
An agrias butterfly Finally, a butterfly that don't make me tired to look at.
Too spangly, emperor butterfly. Far too spangly.
You kids got it too good now Why, when I was your age, we had to read our school primers by firefly light!
They call this thing an Atlas moth, but that seems a bit ambitious to me. I'm just gonna call it "Mappy"!
I'm told my noggin's fairly large, but the Queen Alexandra's birdwing is somehow even bigger!
You can put the tail down, Mr. Scorpion. You ain't gotta prove anything to me.
Wasps and I are kindred spirits. Just let us about our business, and we won't bother no one.
How's a fella supposed to tell it's a firefly if it ain't glowin'?
Y'know, a friend I used to have once told me I looked a bit like a man-faced stink bug...
A walking leaf looks just like a regular leaf to me. Why's everyone so excited?
I used to think the sound of a bell cricket was soothing. Now I think it's just too dang loud.
You gotta break outta your shell now and then. Eyein' a cicada shell's a good reminder of that!
Now there's a shade of blue I can get behind. Much obliged, rosalia batesi beetle.
The damselfly's got a svelte look to it. It's quite somethin'!
If I'm not mistaken, this is the selfsame mosquito that snuck a long sip of me a while back.
You're the entomologist who donated this little one? Well, that's mighty impressive, !
A shame these bugs can't settle their differences without resortin' to brawlin',
